SHORT TITLE : Olympic Silver Medal Of Hidlyn Diaz
ABSTRACT : Rep. Lopez (M.) took the floor to give due honor and recognition to Ms. Hidilyn Diaz for bagging the silver medal in the 53-kilogram class in the women’s division weightlifting competition at the 31st Olympiad currently being held in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. After informing his peers of his personal knowledge of Ms. Diaz’s struggles as an athlete from the first time she joined the weightlifting competition until her victory at the Rio Olympics, Rep. Lopez said that in recognition of a well-deserved victory, he and other Members have filed House Resolutions commending and congratulating Ms. Diaz and the Philippine Weightlifting Association headed by former Rep. Monico O. Puentevella for bringing pride and honor to the country. Moreover, he said that he would take the cudgels in ensuring that the interest of the national athletes will have a voice in the House. He also commended the Filipino sportsmen and sportswomen who embody the hopes and aspirations of the people for their dedication and outstanding representation of the nation. In closing, he expressed hope that the nation would take inspiration from the athletes who have demonstrated what teamwork and unity can achieve and that the example of Olympians would continue to be a source of positive transformation in the life journey of the nation and the people. (SOURCE: House Journal No.7,p.48)
